lines: In this workshop we want to show you a complete and fully functional Live Setup for the stage
"Live" means, you can musically interact with the music (by arranging and mixing the tracks on-the-fly)
title: Linux Live on Stage - SuperBoucle, Carla, Faust & LV2 Plugins

title: Plugin Programming with Faust

title: loop - Open educational instruments made in pure data

title: Stepp0r a renoise plugin

title: LAC is dead! Long live miniLAC!

lines: This Workshop is in addition to the Lecture, and focuses on LUA scripting to create renoise plugins (like Stepp0r)
title: Stepp0r a renoise plugin

lines: Talk addresses the specific character of software, written as a hobby, and what a user, unfamiliar with a hobbyist community and the body of hobbyist software, should expect from such software in term
title: On Hobbyist Software

lines: A challenge to produce a music track within 60 minutes
Participants get a short MIDI file as a starting point, and work on their track using the tools and techniques of their choice
title: One Hour Challenge

lines: This hacking event will be for creating and porting audio plugins
It will be mostly focused on [https://github
com/DISTRHO/DPF DPF] but the contents are applicable to other frameworks

title: Let's make some plugins!

lines: Modal synthesis is a sound synthesis technique that bridges the gap between traditional "unidirectional" signal processing and computer simulation of acoustic phenomena
After explaining the theory
title: Modal Synthesis using Synth-A-Modeler

lines: This hands-on workshop introduces participants to Bela, an open source embedded platform for ultra-low latency audio and sensor processing based on the BeagleBone Black
We will present the hardware
title: BELA - an open-source embedded platform for low-latency interactive audio

lines: This hacking event (60 mins) will be for publishing your existing LV2 audio/midi plugins to the MOD Cloud system
Topics:  * Verification (ttl validation and basic error checking) * Cross-compile * C
title: Publishing your LV2 plugins to the MOD Cloud

lines: This workshop (90 min) will give an introduction to physical modeling using examples that participants are invited to modify in order to create their own new physical models

title: Physical Modeling using Synth-A-Modeler

lines: An informal demonstration and explanation of some of the less obvious features of Yoshimi, highlighting usability and convenience
* Configuration and Recent History * Audio and Midi routing * Roots,
title: Getting to know Yoshimi

lines: Dave, excds and riot wrap things up and say goodbye
You've been there!
title: Closing
